mn134:1.3: Lomasakaṅgiya’s verse speaks of his determination to forge his way through the dense jungle in search of seclusion ([thag1.27]()). He is probably also the same monk who appears in [sn54.12](). His name means “hairy-limbs”.
mn134:2.1: The god Candana, whose name means “sandalwood”, also appears at [dn20:10.5](), [dn32:10.4](), and [sn2:2.15]().
mn134:2.11: This suggests that Candana was one of the Thirty-three. | _Paṇḍukambala_ is a kind of luxury upholstery.
